2015.context: Lyft, Inc. is a rideshare and transportation company focused on ridesharing, bikes, scooters, and autonomous vehicles. Growing rideshare competitor to Uber. US-only focus.

competitors.name: Uber
competitors.notes: Dominant global competitor with ~80% US market share

competitors.name: Sidecar
competitors.notes: Smaller ride-sharing competitor (shut down 2015)

competitors.name: Gett
competitors.notes: Corporate-focused ride service

competitors.name: Via
competitors.notes: Shared ride platform in urban areas

competitors.name: Juno
competitors.notes: NYC-focused ride-hailing startup

competitors.name: Traditional Taxis
competitors.notes: Legacy taxi industry being disrupted

competitors.name: Car Rentals
competitors.notes: Traditional car rental companies like Hertz, Enterprise

competitors.name: Public Transit
competitors.notes: Mass transit systems competing for urban transportation

2020.context: Lyft, Inc. is a rideshare and transportation company focused on ridesharing, bikes, scooters, and autonomous vehicles. COVID-19 devastated rides. Sold autonomous division.

competitors.name: Uber
competitors.notes: Primary competitor with larger scale and diversified business

competitors.name: Via
competitors.notes: Shared ride and transit technology platform

competitors.name: Waymo
competitors.notes: Autonomous vehicle company developing robotaxi service

competitors.name: Cruise
competitors.notes: GM's autonomous vehicle subsidiary

competitors.name: Traditional Taxis
competitors.notes: Taxi industry adapting with apps and modernization

competitors.name: Car Ownership
competitors.notes: Personal vehicle ownership as pandemic reduced shared rides

competitors.name: Gett
competitors.notes: B2B ride service for corporate customers

competitors.name: Public Transit
competitors.notes: Reduced transit also faced pandemic challenges

2024.context: Lyft, Inc. is a rideshare and transportation company focused on ridesharing, bikes, scooters, and autonomous vehicles. Rideshare recovery. Focus on driver and rider experience.

competitors.name: Uber
competitors.notes: Dominant competitor with ~72% US ride-hailing share and delivery business

competitors.name: Waymo
competitors.notes: Expanding autonomous ride-hailing in San Francisco and Phoenix

competitors.name: Cruise
competitors.notes: GM autonomous vehicles, though operations paused after incidents

competitors.name: Tesla Robotaxi
competitors.notes: Announced autonomous ride-hailing plans

competitors.name: Via
competitors.notes: Transit technology and shared ride platform

competitors.name: Traditional Taxis
competitors.notes: Modernized taxi services with app booking

competitors.name: Public Transit
competitors.notes: Mass transit systems improving service

competitors.name: Micromobility
competitors.notes: E-bikes and scooters for short trips

2025.context: Lyft, Inc. is a rideshare and transportation company focused on ridesharing, bikes, scooters, and autonomous vehicles. US rideshare player. Competing with Uber, autonomous vehicles.

competitors.name: Uber
competitors.notes: Dominant global competitor with rides, delivery, and AV partnerships

competitors.name: Waymo
competitors.notes: Google's autonomous ride-hailing service expanding coverage

competitors.name: Tesla
competitors.notes: Robotaxi service threatening ride-hailing incumbents

competitors.name: Zoox (Amazon)
competitors.notes: Amazon's autonomous vehicle robotaxi development

competitors.name: Via
competitors.notes: Transit technology and dynamic shared rides

competitors.name: Revel
competitors.notes: Electric vehicle ride-hailing in urban markets

competitors.name: Public Transit
competitors.notes: Improved mass transit competing for urban trips

competitors.name: Micromobility
competitors.notes: E-bikes and scooters from Lime, Bird for short distances

mentionedBy.name: Uber Technologies, Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Primary US competitor focused on friendlier brand positioning

mentionedBy.name: Uber Technologies, Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: US ride-hailing competitor also struggling with pandemic impact

mentionedBy.name: Uber Technologies, Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: US ride-hailing competitor with ~25% market share, focused on rides only

mentionedBy.name: Uber Technologies, Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: US ride-hailing competitor focused on North American market
